class.name: ontology.classes.PlannedWork
class.description: Represents the idea of a human construction to come. Contains all the specifics required for construction.

method.name: isBuilt
method.description: Returns true if this element is entierly built.

method.name: createIt
method.description:
To create and build this element.
This impementation allows the agent to make this element be created and built to 100% instantaneously.

method.name: deconstructIt
method.description: To deconstruct (and then remove) this element. Returns 'true' when element is deconstructed.

method.name: removeIt
method.description: To remove instantaneously an existing work without any physical capability considerations.

method.name: canBeDeconstructed
method.description:
Returns 'true' if agent is able to deconstruct this element.
This implementation returns 'false', a planned object is not constructed and it cannot be deconstructed.

argument.name: instantaneously
argument.description: Define if this element has to be deconstructed instantaneously ("magic" action) or not.

method.name: isDeconstructed
method.description: Returns 'true' if this element has been deconstructed (by deconstruction action or a "magic" destruction action), 'false' otherwise.

method.name: getDestinationForWork
method.description:
Returns the nearest reachable destination for this element.
This implementation returns an empty table (TEMPORARY).

method.name: canBeCreated
method.description: Returns 'True' if agent has the physical capability to create and build this element.

argument.name: instantaneously
argument.description: Define if this element has to be built instantaneously ("magic" action) or not.

method.name: buildIt
method.description:
To create and build this element.
This impementation allows the agent to create and build this element until 100%. Because this action checks physical capabilities of the agent, it should take time (see delays of objects construction within the authoring tool).
